wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation

Interface ImageContrast

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageContrastIJ

    public interface ImageContrast
    Author:
    RÃ©my Malgouyres Provides methods to adjust Brightness and Contrast (i.e adjust the display range).

    • Method Detail

      • adjustContrastBrightness

        ImageCore adjustContrastBrightness(double contrastFactor,
                                   double brightnessFactor)
        Adjusts the contrast, brightness to change the display range of an image. The method maps linearly pixel values in the display range to display values in the range 0--255. Pixels with a value less than the minimum are set to black and those with a value greater than the maximum are set to white. Contrast change is applied first, and then the brightness shift.
        Parameters:
        contrastFactor - ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, Increases or decreases image contrast by varying the width of the display range. The narrower the display range, the higher the contrast
        brightnessFactor - ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, Increases or decreases image brightness by moving the display range
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern

      • adjustValuesRange

        ImageCore adjustValuesRange(double min,
                            double max)
        Sets the minimum and maximum value of the display range. The gray levels are linearly scaled to adjust the min and max gray levels to given values, and then scale the gray levels to occupy all the range of possible colors. Pixels with a value greater than the maximum are set to white.
        Parameters:
        min - new minimum value of the display range, between 0.0 and 1.0, in fraction of the total values range for the bit depth.
        max - new maximum value of the display range, between 0.0 and 1.0, in fraction of the total values range for the bit depth.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern

      • getMinValue

        int getMinValue()
        Returns:
        The minimum gray level in the image

      • getMaxValue

        int getMaxValue()
        Returns:
        The maximum gray level in the image

      • maximizeValuesRange

        ImageCore maximizeValuesRange()
        Sets the minimum and maximum value of the display range to 0 and (2^getBitDepth()-1). The gray levels are linearly scaled to adjust the min and max gray levels to given values. Pixels with a value greater than the maximum are set to white.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern

      • equalize

        ImageCore equalize(double powExponent,
                   double powValue,
                   double saturationReduction)
        Changes the tone curves of images. It should bring up the detail in the flat regions of your image. Histogram Equalization can enhance meaningless detail and hide important but small high-contrast features. This method uses a similar algorithm, but uses the square root of the histogram values, so its effects are less extreme.
        Parameters:
        powExponent - Exponent on the histogram value in the histogram integration
        powValue - Exponent on the output value
        saturationReduction - between -1 (Saturate more) and +1 (saturate less)
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern

      • stretchHistogram

        ImageCore stretchHistogram(double saturatedProportion)
        Parameters:
        saturatedProportion - The proportion between 0.0 (zero) and 1.0 (one) of voxels which are allowed to ba clamped because their values go beyond the maximal gray level value.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
